Smash Burgers

Yield: 4 burgers

beef
burger

Ingredients

Burger Patties

  • 1 lb ground beef, divided into 1/4 lb balls
  • Thinly sliced white cheddar cheese
  • Diced onions

Toppings

  • Butter lettuce leaves
  • Tomato slices
  • Fry sauce (see separate recipe)

Buns

  • 4 _basic_ burger buns, toasted

Procedure

Cooking the Patties

  1. Roll ground beef into 1/4 lb balls.
  2. Heat a cast iron skillet over high heat.
  3. Place a beef ball on the hot skillet and, using a protein press, metal spatula, or bottom of a saucepan, smash the ball into a thin patty.
  4. Cook until the top side is only slightly pink.
  5. Add a handful of diced onions to the skillet and flip the patty on top of the onions.
  6. Place a slice of white cheddar cheese on the patty, cover, and cook until the cheese melts.
  7. While the cheese melts, assemble the rest of the burger

Assembly

  1. Spread fry sauce on the bottom bun.
  2. Layer with a lettuce leaf and a slice of tomato.
  3. Place the patty with onions on top of the tomato (consider adding a second patty for a double!).
  4. Spread fry sauce on the top bun and place it on the burger.
